newsitem.title: USA: BT Office Q3 hurt by soft German market.
newsitem.headline: BT Office Q3 hurt by soft German market.

text.p: BT Office Products International Inc said income gains in the third quarter were held back by softness in the German market, where operating margins were below the prior year levels.
The company also cited the cost structure at its New York division, which president Rudolf Huyzer said "is not yet in line with our other divisions."

Huyzer added in a statement, "While we have protected our sales levels in New York and maintained projected gross margins, we intend to make further changes there to increase profitability." He did not elaborate.

"Acquiring established, quality office products distributors in the U.S. and Europe continues to be an important component of our strategy," Huyzer said. "In the first nine months of 1996, we completed acquisitions with combined annualized sales of over $200 million."

Earlier on Tuesday BT Office reported third-quarter earnings of $2.7 million or $0.08 per share compared with $2.1 million or $0.07 per share a year earlier. Sales advanced to $354.9 million from $277.7 million.
